entry.title: 2/22 - Open Call for an Exhibition Focusing on Experiences & Perspectives of Mental Health
entry.content:
Long Island City Arts (LIC-A)
üìç Long Island City, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 02/22/2019 deadline
üí∞ $40.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

Open Call for an Exhibition
Focusing On Experiences & Perspectives of Mental Health

http://licartists.formstack.com/forms/submission_form_inside_outside

Location: The Plaxall Gallery
5-25 46th Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11101
Exhibition on View: March 7th, 2019 to April 7th, 2019
Reception: Saturday, March 9th, 7-10PM

Submission Fee: $20.00 for LiC-A members, $40.00 for non-members

Submit artwork to http://licartists.formstack.com
Mediums: All Mediums - original art or limited signed and numbered reproductions

Exhibition concept:
An open call for artwork reflecting the many experiences and perspectives of Mental Illness. Visually communicating Mindfulness, Contemplation, or Meditation, as well as the experience of healing, suffering, and the stigma of mental health from the outside looking in or from the inside looking out.
Artwork can reflect personal experience, journeys, depiction of mental health or what mental health means to you.

Please e-mail info@licartists.org with any questions.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Submit Application to
http://licartists.formstack.com/forms/submission_form_inside_outside
or
visit Long Island City Artist website www.licartists.org

All Mediums - original art or limited signed and numbered reproductions.

entry.title: 4/1 - Juxtaposition: Contemporary Collage, A National Juried Art Exhibition
entry.content:
Barrett Art Center (Dutchess County Art Association)
üìç Poughkeepsie, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 04/01/2019 deadline
üí∞ $45.00 fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

Juror: Marshall N. Price, Nancy Hanks Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, Nasher Museum of Art.

Deadline: April 1, 2019
Exhibition Dates: Jun 8 ‚Äì July 20, 2019

$500 Juror‚Äôs Prize, $200 Second Prize, $125 Honorable Mention

Barrett Art Center seeks submissions that explore contemporary collage. Paper on paper is welcome however, given the overwhelming number of images and objects people are bombarded with each day, Barrett also welcomes submissions that use disparate objects, sources, and materials. This national juried exhibition welcomes all medias that encompass collage, assemblage, photomontage, digital collage, and mixed-media approaches that use found imagery, cut outs, typography, cut-and-paste, and installation.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

All submission through: https://artist.callforentry.org
